en-US.title: On-Device Command-line Utilities
en-US.description: A set of tools available on your device to help you configure a slew of options

en-US.title: Windows 10 IoT Core Porting Tool
en-US.description: A tool for helping you port your existing Win32 and Windows CE applications to Windows 10 IoT Core

en-US.title: Using PowerShell
en-US.description: Allows Remote Administration and Configuration so that you can remotely configure and manage any Windows IoT Core device

en-US.title: Using SSH
en-US.description: Allows Remote Administration and Configuration of your Windows IoT Core device over SSH

en-US.title: Hardware Pin Mappings
en-US.description: Pinout and interfacing information for GPIO, SPI, and I2C

Raspberry Pi 2 and 3 Pinout
MinnowBoard Max Pinout
Dragonboard Pinout

en-US.title: AllJoyn Connectivity
en-US.description: Learn more about AllJoyn and explore the capabilities of the AllJoyn Device System Bridge with Windows 10 IoT Core

en-US.title: Unavailable Universal APIs
en-US.description: Windows IoT Core is a work in progress. Here are the UWP APIs that have not been implemented yet on our platform

en-US.title: Ecosystem Compatibility List
en-US.description: Find a list of supported peripherals, interfaces, and protocols on Window 10 IoT Core devices

en-US.title: Visual Studio App Deployment
en-US.description: Use Visual Studio to deploy and debug applications on your Windows 10 IoT Core device

en-US.title: Using WINDBG
en-US.description: Use WINDBG to debug

en-US.title: Glossary
en-US.description: A list of commonly used phrases and their meanings

en-US.title: Windows Device Portal
en-US.description: Connect to, control, configure, and get advanced diagnostics about your machine from the web

en-US.title: Make your 3D Printer Wireless
en-US.description: Turn your Windows 10 IoT Core device into a print server and connect your 3D Printer to it. You will be able to access your printer wirelessly from other devices.

en-US.title: Headed and Headless devices
en-US.description: Windows IoT Core can either be in headed or headless mode. The difference is the presence or absence of any form of UI

en-US.title: Access your files using FTP
en-US.description: Access the files on your device using FTP

en-US.title: Access your files using Windows File Sharing
en-US.description: Access the files on your device using Windows file sharing

en-US.title: WiFi Connectivity
en-US.description: Setup and configure WiFi on your Windows IoT Core device

en-US.title: Bluetooth Support
en-US.description: Windows IoT Core Bluetooth support information

en-US.title: Embedded Mode
en-US.description: Enable embedded mode on desktop and mobile

en-US.title: Windows 10 IoT Core Pro
en-US.description: Create a Windows 10 IoT Core Pro image

en-US.title: Unified Write Filter
en-US.description: Enable a write filter on your OS image

en-US.title: Securing IoT Devices with TPMs
en-US.description: Learn about Trusted Platform Modules (TPMs), along with various implementations on IoT Core as well as code samples

en-US.title: Enabling Secure Boot and BitLocker
en-US.description: Learn how to secure your IoT device by enabling Secure Boot and BitLocker device encryption on supported IoT Core devices

en-US.title: Enabling Internet Connection Sharing
en-US.description: Learn how to enable Internet Connection Sharing on your IoT Core device by bridging a Software Wi-Fi Access Point and Ethernet adapter

en-US.title: Network Packet Capture
en-US.description: Use Microsoft Message Analyzer to capture network packets from your Windows 10 IoT Core device

en-US.title: Remote display experience for Windows 10 IoT Core
en-US.description: Learn how to put a display on any displayless device with this new technology.

en-US.title: Arduino and Windows 10
en-US.description: Arduino and Windows 10 work together to help you make amazing projects. Our technologies support the Arduino Uno and Mega, as well as the new Arduino 101.
